title: New concretizer: target ranges treated incorrectly
body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install clingo@master
$ spack load clingo@master
$ spack solve superlu-dist%gcc@10.1.0 cuda_arch=61 ^cuda@10.1.243
...
```

### Error Message

The above concretization should not be possible because gcc@10.1.0 conflicts with cuda 10.1.243 and will generate compiler unsupported compiler errors if used.  The same request with spack spec correctly returns the following error:

```console
$ spack spec superlu-dist%gcc@10.1.0 cuda_arch=61 ^cuda@10.1.243
spack spec superlu-dist cuda_arch=61 \^cuda@10.1.243
Input spec
--------------------------------
superlu-dist cuda_arch=61
    ^cuda@10.1.243

Concretized
--------------------------------
==> Error: Conflicts in concretized spec "superlu-dist@6.4.0%gcc@10.1.0~cuda~int64~ipo~openmp+shared build_type=RelWithDebInfo cuda_arch=61 arch=linux-gentoo2-skylake/yzk5kz6"

List of matching conflicts for spec:

    superlu-dist@6.4.0%gcc@10.1.0~cuda~int64~ipo~openmp+shared build_type=RelWithDebInfo cuda_arch=61 arch=linux-gentoo2-skylake
        ^cmake@3.18.4%gcc@10.1.0~doc+ncurses+openssl+ownlibs~qt patches=bf695e3febb222da2ed94b3beea600650e4318975da90e4a71d6f31a6d5d8c3d arch=linux-gentoo2-skylake
        ^cuda@10.1.243%gcc@10.1.0 arch=linux-gentoo2-skylake
        ^metis@5.1.0%gcc@10.1.0~gdb~int64~real64+shared build_type=Release patches=4991da938c1d3a1d3dea78e49bbebecba00273f98df2a656e38b83d55b281da1,b1225da886605ea558db7ac08dd8054742ea5afe5ed61ad4d0fe7a495b1270d2 arch=linux-gentoo2-skylake
        ^openblas@0.3.12%gcc@10.1.0~consistent_fpcsr~ilp64+pic+shared threads=none arch=linux-gentoo2-skylake
        ^openmpi@3.1.6%gcc@10.1.0~atomics~cuda~cxx~cxx_exceptions+gpfs~java~legacylaunchers~lustre~memchecker~pmi~singularity~sqlite3+static~thread_multiple+vt+wrapper-rpath fabrics=none schedulers=none arch=linux-gentoo2-skylake
            ^hwloc@1.11.11%gcc@10.1.0~cairo~cuda~gl~libudev+libxml2~netloc~nvml+pci+shared arch=linux-gentoo2-skylake
                ^libpciaccess@0.16%gcc@10.1.0 arch=linux-gentoo2-skylake
                    ^libtool@2.4.6%gcc@10.1.0 arch=linux-gentoo2-skylake
                        ^m4@1.4.18%gcc@10.1.0+sigsegv patches=3877ab548f88597ab2327a2230ee048d2d07ace1062efe81fc92e91b7f39cd00,fc9b61654a3ba1a8d6cd78ce087e7c96366c290bc8d2c299f09828d793b853c8 arch=linux-gentoo2-skylake
                            ^libsigsegv@2.12%gcc@10.1.0 arch=linux-gentoo2-skylake
                    ^pkgconf@1.6.3%gcc@10.1.0 arch=linux-gentoo2-skylake
                    ^util-macros@1.19.1%gcc@10.1.0 arch=linux-gentoo2-skylake
                ^libxml2@2.9.10%gcc@10.1.0~python arch=linux-gentoo2-skylake
                    ^libiconv@1.16%gcc@10.1.0 arch=linux-gentoo2-skylake
                    ^xz@5.2.5%gcc@10.1.0~pic arch=linux-gentoo2-skylake
                    ^zlib@1.2.11%gcc@10.1.0+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-gentoo2-skylake
                ^numactl@2.0.14%gcc@10.1.0 patches=4e1d78cbbb85de625bad28705e748856033eaafab92a66dffd383a3d7e00cc94 arch=linux-gentoo2-skylake
                    ^autoconf@2.69%gcc@10.1.0 arch=linux-gentoo2-skylake
                        ^perl@5.30.3%gcc@10.1.0~cpanm+shared+threads arch=linux-gentoo2-skylake
                    ^automake@1.16.2%gcc@10.1.0 arch=linux-gentoo2-skylake
        ^parmetis@4.0.3%gcc@10.1.0~gdb~int64~ipo+shared build_type=RelWithDebInfo patches=4f892531eb0a807eb1b82e683a416d3e35154a455274cf9b162fb02054d11a5b,50ed2081bc939269689789942067c58b3e522c269269a430d5d34c00edbc5870,704b84f7c7444d4372cb59cca6e1209df4ef3b033bc4ee3cf50f369bce972a9d arch=linux-gentoo2-skylak
```

Here is what spack solve returns

<details>
<summary>$ spack --debug solve superlu-dist cuda_arch=60 \^cuda@10.1.243</summary>

